posts.title: Researcher Spotlight: Joyce Johnson
posts.text: She describes her three years of work in the Berg Collection using the Jack Kerouac archive.

posts.title: Bruce Jay Friedman, A Story Teller: Humanizing Humility
posts.text: The term Black Humor was coined in the 1960s by critics who regarded him as a founder, and although Friedman admits that he was never fond of the term, it is true that he helped pioneer this darker comic tone that was grimmer than conventional satire.
